intro: Epitaberna, commonly known as the "mountain orchid," is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to high-altitude regions. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, intricate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and requires cool, moist conditions to thrive. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces fragrant blooms during the spring season. Due to its habitat specificity, Epitaberna is considered a vulnerable species in its natural environment.
